title: Rule for decision
text: If $$p$$ is smaller than alpha, reject the null. Smaller $$p-values$$ mean stronger evidence against the null.

hintAnswer: There is statistically significant evidence of an association between the variables
title: Draw a conclusion
text: What does this say about the relationship?
choices: There is statistically significant evidence of an association between the variables
The variables are proven to have a causal relationship
There is no evidence of any relationship
The correlation must be extremely strong.
